item.title: Short Bio Sketch
item.description: Brittany Phillips is a junior pre-med student at The University of Texas at Austin in the process of getting a BSA in biology along with a pre-health certificate and a minor in business while doing reasearch in a soft tissue biomechanics lab. She participates heavily in intermurals including ultimate frisbee, sand/indoor volleyball, and basketball. She is also a competetive member of both the Texas Running and Texas Rock Climbing Club.

item.title: blogpost
item.description: This semester when we first began using Python, I was a little off put and didn’t immedietly see the benefits of the new tool. It may just be the simplicity of the homework and the code, but I was amazed when we started using Python for nucleotide sequencing. It was amazing that in basically one line of code, I could filter through the long line of nucleotides and find “3-mers” that would show the protein sequence.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

item.title: Project 1
item.description: R Markdown The two datasets chosen for this project were Bad_drivers and partisan_lean_state. The bad drivers dataset shows gives amounts of collisions under circumstances such as speeding, alcohol, etc as well as data on insurance premiums cost and lost based on states. The partisan dataset shows the party of the vote, how they lean, and the Cook Voting Index. I selected the two datasets from the fivethirtyeight to see if there were any potential associations between state, party, and “bad driving”.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(sandwich) race <- read.csv("~/Desktop/TenMileRace P2 data.csv") head(race) ## X state time net age sex ## 1 1 VA 6060 5978 12 M ## 2 2 MD 4515 4457 13 M ## 3 3 VA 5026 4928 13 M ## 4 4 MD 4229 4229 14 M ## 5 5 MD 5293 5076 14 M ## 6 6 VA 6234 5968 14 M I’ve decided to use the TenMileRace data for my second project.
